text: Lynsey de Paul (11 June 1948First name(s) LYNSEY M Last name RUBIN Birth year 1948 Birth quarter 3 Registration month - Mother's last name DE GROOT District SOUTHWARK County London Country England Volume 5D Page 718 Record set England & Wales births 1837-2006 Category Birth, Marriage, Death & Parish Records Record collection Births & baptisms Collections from Great Britain â€“ 1 October 2014) was an English singer-songwriter. She was known for representing the U.K. in the 1977 with Mike Moran on "Rock Bottom" at Eurovision. She was also known for her songs, "Sugar Me", "Getting a Drag","Won't Somebody Dance With Me", Ooh I Do", "No Honestly", "My Man and Me", "Storm In A Teacup" and "Sleeping Blue Nights". De Paul was born in London, England. She was never married, but was known for being in relationships with Ringo Starr, Roy Wood, James Coburn, Sean Connery, Bill Kenwright, Bernie Taupin, Chas Chandler and Dudley Moore. De Paul suffered a brain hemorrhage on the morning of 1 October 2014. She died in a London hospital hours later, aged 66. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website * Category:1948 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from cerebral hemorrhage Category:English singer- songwriters Category:Singers from London Category:Writers from London
title: Lynsey de Paul
